page.title: 19THE FLOOD
page.content: Bridge lane is the lowest lying part of Bramhall with a river flowing alongside.For years it had been prone to flooding, increased by the building of many new houses in the '60s' and their subsequent connection into the already overburdened drainage system. The council began a major project to relay all the main sewers in late 1972; However before work had been completed a very violent thunderstorm in July of 1973 resulted in water gushing from all the grids and the river (Ladybrook) bursting its banks in many places. Shop workers found themselves trapped by the rising water level.At 11.30am when the flooding was at its maximum,the shops and houses were under water to a depth of three feet.The council arranged for a rubber dinghy to rescue the shop workers and householders.
